intro: Godetia amoena var. sonomensis, commonly known as the Sonoma godetia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This species is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
